mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, John Parke Custis to George Washington, 1778 May 29
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Custis, John Parke, 1754-1781
mdRecord.dcterms:description: John Parke Custis, stepson of George Washington, wrote to George Washington who was at Valley Forge about various aspects of the war. He notified him that the Virginia legislature passed bills to help raise troops, the arrival of a French ship carrying uniforms and military supplies, and a note to his mother. Docketed by George Washington. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: United States--History--Revolution, 1775-1783
